newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht midrate fixed at 10-1/2 year low vs dlr.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht midrate fixed at 10-1/2 year low vs dlr.

text.p: The Thai central bank said on Thursday it fixed the baht at a 10-1/2-year low of 26.10 against the strong dollar.
The Thai unit fell in early dealings and was quoted at 26.105/26.110 in thin early trade against 26.080/26.100 late Wednesday.

"The dollar's rise is putting a little pressure on the baht and its trading above its band ... but trade is a bit quiet with no-one wanting to quote because they fear intervention by the Bank of Japan," said a dealer at Bank of Ayudhya.
Japanese officials said earlier they were concerned by excessive foreign exchange movements.
Moody's decision to downgrade Thailand's sovereign credit rating on Wednesday had little impact on baht sentiment as it had been widely anticipated by the market, traders said.
"The decision to reduce the credit of the country may make people a little less confident but I don't think its having a big affect because people had discounted it already," he said.
"Thai commercial banks are largely holding their positions...People are watching for possible intervention by the Japanese central bank," said a dealer at Bangkok Bank.

Liquidity tightened early with the overnight interbank offered rate quoted higher at 9.25-9.75 percent against 8.50-9.00 percent late Wednesday as demand rose ahead of the four-day Thai New Year holiday from this weekend, dealers said.

"Liquidity is a little tighter ahead of the long weekend ... I think the Bank of Thailand will also like see the rates stick higher to help stop possible speculation against the baht," said the dealer at Bangkok Bank.
The one-month dollar baht swap edged higher at 6.50/7.00 satang early Wednesday against 6.00/7.00 late on Wednesday.
